author: Tony Tobin
method: Place the salmon in a pan and cover it with water. Add the lemon slices and peppercorns and bring to the boil. Poach for 1 minute and turn off the heat.  Remove the salmon and drain on kitchen paper. Meanwhile, add the leeks to a small pan and drizzle with the olive oil and vinegar. Cook over a low heat for ten minutes, until the leeks are tender and have lost their bitterness. Serve the leeks on a warm plate and top with the poached salmon.
ingredients: 100g/3½oz skinless salmon fillet,  ½ lemon, sliced,  6 black peppercorns,  1 leek, sliced,  1 tbsp olive oil,  2 tbsp white wine vinegar
